abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project was
            satisfactory, having achieved its project objectives,
            namely, the increase in girls' participation enrollment
            rates. In spite of the extremely difficult conditions in
            Sindh over the last ten years, sustainability is likely,
            although some innovative features, introduced under the
            project, remain uncertain due to financial constraints. The
            lessons convey that although provision of primary education
            improved, experience suggests that boys' education
            enrollment cannot be taken for granted, - for, project
            incentives were mainly designed for girls participation -
            and boys education should also be prioritized when planning
            for primary education improvement. Educational strategies
            require realistic assessments of the managerial technical
            capacity of implementing, managing, and financial
            institutions, thus, the development of a sustained capacity
            to design improved policies, and programs, remains a high
            priority. The report further emphasizes the need for
            synchronized planning in both, physical facilities for
            schools with the related architects/engineers, and,
            procurement capacity, which should be assessed early, in
            accordance with the Bank's procurement guidelines.
            While project ownership is paramount for implementing
            agencies to sustain activities and skills, technical
            assistance should be provided in support of the
            borrower's efforts, ensuring the transfer, and
            sustainability of those skills.
